metadata.name: Resorting #95
metadata.description:
The idea of living within close proximity to nature has enticed people for centuries, especially for the ones used to living in bustling cities. Just picturing a cozy resort in the countryside, or playing music that resembles the feelings of holiday-making can drive us to go on a well-deserved vacation. Even when we don’t know where to, or whether we have the time or resources to slip out of our busy days, or even if that destination exists only in our imaginations. But when we do entertain ourselves with such ideas, we feel like we have taken a step to heal ourselves or to give our mind a worthy time out.

On the other hand, we have been living in human-focused settlements like cities for around 10,000 years, and we have all we need in an urban landscape, yet the idea of living in a secluded resort close to nature kept inviting us. This begs the question: were we supposed to live adjacent to nature to live well? Is it in our nature that we are wired to go back to the world beyond our doors? Or was it because we are aware of how big nature is, and how little time and resources we have to explore them all?

------------
Press [s] to save captured image
------------
It may take a few seconds to render, depending on the device.

created using WEBGL on p5.js
dirbots - Dec22

metadata.name: Mantle #332
metadata.description:
A colourful graphic exploration that I started in December 2021 and didn't finish until just now. 
Happy birthday FX! #fxhashturnsone

metadata.name: Flower Arrangement #202
metadata.description:
Flower arrangement made by code.

Possible features:
- Style: Natural, Oval, Triangular, Grassy
- Orientation: Square, Portrait, Landscape
- Palette: White, Cream, Tan, Pink, Green, Blue, Yellow, Orange
- Primary flower: Mix, Gerbera, Gerbera 2, Dahlia, Dahlia 2, Spiky, Unknown
- Primary color: Random, Light, Dark
- Secondary color: Random, Light, Dark
- Vase shape: Cylinder, Tumbler, Round, Curve
- Dish: true, false
- Table: true, false
- Texture: true, false

Live view options:
- Press "s" key: Saves the high resolution image (3300 x 3300 for square, 4200 x 3300 for portrait, 3300 x 4200 for landscape)

Depending on the device you run it on, it may take some time for the drawing to complete.
Best viewed in larger window size.
Made with p5js.

August 2022
ykxotkx

metadata.name: Windswept #43
metadata.description:
Windswept

Press 's' in live view to download a copy of your image.

You can add the URL parameter 'scale' to scale the size of the image for a higher resolution download (1600x2000 by default). For example, for a 3200x4000 image, add '&scale=2' to the end of the URL. 1, 2, 3, 4, and 5 are valid inputs. (Warning: large numbers may not work depending on your hardware/browser and can produce a very large download file of ~100mb)

teaboswell, 2022
License: CC BY-NC-ND 4.0
For third party license information, please see bundle.js.LICENSE.txt

metadata.name: Nebula, Solitude #25
metadata.description:
Nebula is one of the most magnificent stellar phenomena to behold. It is a distinct luminescent part of the interstellar medium, which consists of ionized gas and cosmic dust. Nebulae are often star-forming regions, where stars are born in solitude but surrounded by beautiful light and matter.

In this series, I continue the exploration of color and gravity, the effect of mass on speed, the effect of speed on hue, and how light can change by passing through big particles and dust systems.

I also want to let you participate in the creation of your artwork variation too. Each iteration is a unique and unpredictable dance of light in the dust and gravitation between matter clusters, however,  with the controls listed below, you can change the probability of light/dust blocks as well as the tiling layout.

[L] - create a new layout
[S] - reshuffle the current layout

[Shift] + [1] - change dust blocks probability to 0.0 and reshuffle the current layout
[Shift] + [2] - —//— 0.2
[Shift] + [3] - —//— 0.4
[Shift] + [4] - —//— 0.6
[Shift] + [5] - —//— 0.8
[Shift] + [6] - —//— 1.0

Basics:
[A] - skip/restart the animation

[1] - save PNG in low resolution
[2] - save PNG in medium resolution
[3] - save PNG in high resolution
[4] - save PNG in ultra-high resolution

Experimental zone:
[E] - toggle endless animation
[0] - save the current frame in low resolution

Saving with high and ultra-high resolution may take a while, please be patient.

Use Chrome 107 for the best experience, other browsers are significantly slower on this artwork, visual results also may vary.

Made with love and p5js

By Collapsar Beauty
CC BY-NC-ND 4.0

metadata.name: Radio Gel #26
metadata.description:
A generative liquid, made with solgel.

An infinite feedback loop.
where frequencies collide.

metadata.name: EDDY #108
metadata.description:
An eddy is a circular movement of water counter to a main current. It reminds me of innovations in art, like a small countercurrent to the mainstream, surfacing new techniques and aesthetics. 

I hope that EDDY will brighten your days with its playful swirl of colors, inspired by the sea, the sky, the birds, and post-impressionist paintings.

Keyboard Controls:
[F] Fill the window.
[S] Save the current view in live mode as an image (default 1125x1500px).
[1] [2] [4] [6] Change resolution, 1.5K to 9K.
[R] Reverse course.

Made with p5js and shaders.

Created by elsif, 2022.12.

metadata.name: Fresh Fruit #29
metadata.description:
Fruit so fresh you could smell it.

made entirely in code with p5js.

metadata.name: Life has no scores #109
metadata.description:
We cannot compose life, at best we hum along to the melodies that life has been played in front of us. Looking back at the scores of our lives, the notations are never neatly noted, but fully felt.  Rewinding the songs of life are our memories, whether sad, happy, angry, or melancholy. It is not clear whether I am dreaming or awake, but our songs all do end. 

In this final drop (for ?), I have reused the first ever class calligraphy(){} I have written from my genesis drop “Nothing comes from nothing”. As time passes, 10 drops later, across almost to the year, I am grateful for the progress I have made, as an artist, and more importantly as a human. After all, what is behind the code of generative art is a human being. 

Scores of music, scrolls of calligraphy, calendar or diary, notating life, time passes, and changes are inevitable. Sometimes we sing louder in laughter and joy, sometimes we scribble in uneasiness, sometimes we just get lost in neon lights. Life goes on. You and me, all the same and yet different.  

There are too many friend artists, friend collectors, fxhash team members, to thank for helping me through this journey. I would like to pay homage to Rudxane in this work, who has taken me under his wings, mentoring and encouraging me in art as well as showing me some degen stuff on the side:-). This homage is not copy-minting, or copying of styles, which I do not have the coding skills to do so even if I wanted to. But it is the influence of taste in many works of Rudxane. In a vague but agreeable taste, I present to you Life has no scores. 

What I was taught was disrupted, and grid studies left unfinished, and oh do we have a BINGO?

Tested on Chrome. Other browsers may render different or not at all (firefox)

Press ‘2’ to save png.

Copyright (©) 2022 Jimi Wen
Licensed under CC BY-NC-SA 4.0

metadata.name: Trace_Deep #80
metadata.description:
H
H
H
H

p5.js


Try left mouse button and mouse wheel.
------------
Press 'i'  ->  info.
(📱Press and hold for 1s  ->  info.)
------------
Press 's' (fullscreen)  ->  png.
Add "&px=" to the end of the url to change the resolution in the range (1-6), the default is 2.
For example: &px=4, you will get an image with 4 times the size of the window.

metadata.name: Energy Refraction #31
metadata.description:
In celebration of one year of fxhash.

This generative work is inspired by color palettes from nature and the universe. The general idea is to simulate in the code, a mix between two traditional forms of painting like watercolor and ink on relief with refraction of light and shadow.


Entirely created in p5js.
License: CC BY-NC-ND 4.0

metadata.name: Emotions #65
metadata.description:
1) INTRO (MUST READ)
"Emotions" is a unique Animated, watercolor or liquid painting-like abstract generative artwork which incorporates some "innovative" or unique techniques and approaches.

If find the above too selfish or wonder if its worth to buy this sh**t in a relative high price from an unknown "artist" please give some time to read the whole description. You will not regret!

I don't like to talk about myself or using marketing expressions, however sometimes have to, in order to clarify some points & spot some important features

All started as an exercise to shaders on Nov. 2022 and is the completion of this experimentation (rotating colors): twitter.com/Uniray_net/status/1587588272842280961 


2) SHORT BIO
I was always between graphics & programming. Was very good in both areas (as my teachers were saying) & remember me also drawing from childhood 
The first years i was focusing more in graphics (i was teaching graphics as well) and i was programming graphics for hobby

From 2005 & later i started a turn in my career & made programming my profession for the last 13-14 years (developer in some private companies)
In 2020 I started again a more serious involvement with graphics without knowing anything about NFTs or WEB3. And from 2021 i started getting more & more involved. Still so many to learn

I am new in gen art, started few months ago with plain javascript.
Started learning p5js in Aug. 2002 and shaders in Oct. 2022 & "Emotions" is my first "large" work. 
Already published some simpler & old works (eg. 3D) & things i developed as i was learning

3) FEATURES
I think i am presenting something relatively different with "Emotions" & always try to apply one of my favorite motto: "Lead, don't follow"

The general experience in programming & the fact that i had already programmed graphics in conjunction with my love for experimentation & searching behind the things, helped me to incorporate in "Emotions" some "innovative" i believe features & techniques (it sounds selfish but let me explain)

- First i am "proud" of the shader work. I developed completely custom "advanced" techniques that discovered after experimentation & some knowledge of course.

- "Emotions" includes 51 palettes (with several color each) that have been stored externally (in the application folder) as Adobe ".act" color table files so that avoiding hard coded (including all palettes in the code) consuming in this way resources eg. memory from user's system. I just load only the one palette i am going to use

- A fast svg Convolution kernel Matrix filter along with a displacement filter used for the texture

- Lastly & minor, you can switch Orientation (Portrait, Landscape, etc) & Resolution with the press of a key (no need to manually add params in the url)

From the above the most important part is the webGL shader.

4) CONCLUSION
"Emotions" is an animated watercolor painting-like (or liquid pigments material) abstract "live" work, that instead of staying static, starting with an initial state & slowly flowing, changing shapes & colors as sometimes happens with our emotions & feelings which may changed over time. 
Colors also represents emotions eg. red is for passion, green is the color of hope, etc 

Give some time to observe the progress and liquid feel and motion in shapes and colors.  Relax and look the flow and color diffusion - spread  & the whole "painting" to transformed slowly. 

KEYS:
- 1-4: Set resolution from 1x to 4x of the current dimension (slower performance in higher values)
- T: Texture on/off
- S: Save a png file with the current resolution

- P: Change orientation to Portrait (default). Aspect ratio 0.75
- L: Change orientation to Landscape with ratio 4/3
- O: Change orientation to Square (box)
  Due to some 1:1 ratio sensitive calculations, rendering output may differ between orientations

- Spacebar: animation on/off

MOUSE:
- Click: animation on/off
- Move: left - right on canvas (when in animation) to interact

----
Made with p5js & custom shaders. Pure code. No Images used

© Dec. 2022  @Uniray_net | uniray.net

metadata.name: Alleys #89
metadata.description:
a tribute to all the alleys and paths that saved me here at Cabana, my neighborhood

"Want know all alleys? create them!"

Press the [S] to save

This artwork was created with p5.js

metadata.name: Virtual Treasure #33
metadata.description:
This is a "Daily" Series First Collection

"Virtual Treasure" is an interactive conceptual simple game-like work, where the user has as a mission to locate a hot spot by navigating a noise map in order to unlock some hidden functionality.

Some minted items have an "Instant Win" feature, meaning that the owners automatically will be included in a whitelist - allowlist for an upcoming free drop 

For the rest items, there is related hidden short information once you find the hotspot on map and unlock the extra functionality. For the sake of gameplay and fun is not revealed here.


Good luck with the crypto "treasure" hunting :)


CONTROLS & INTERACTIVITY

KEYS:

- S: Save a png file
- SPACEBAR: Start/Stop animation
- ... There are also a couple of hidden keys that will be revealed to you once you find the hotspot on map...


MOUSE:

CLICK & MOVE: Use click and mouse move to navigate in the area and explore the virtual map.

----
Made with p5js

© Nov. 2022  @Uniray_net | uniray.net
